answers.answer: One can offer support by helping with food, products, clothing, transportation, or by volunteering to assist vulnerable people arriving in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Offer support'.

answers.answer: If you suffer from a chronic condition, you can find specialized medical assistance and ask for help.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: One can find support in finding temporary accommodation or provide a space to help vulnerable people by accessing "Un Acoperiș!".
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Housing'.

answers.answer: You can find suitable job opportunities by learning how and where to search for them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Jobs'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children in Romania have rights to education, with information available on how to enroll them in school, kindergarten, or extracurricular activities, including details on Ukrainian schools.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Specialized call-centers are available to provide access to resources, information, and dedicated support for various issues, depending on your needs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Call-center'.

answers.answer: Pro bono legal help is offered to Ukrainian refugees in Romania and other countries.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Legal help'.

answers.answer: If you need transportation or technical assistance for your vehicle in an emergency, you can find out how to get help.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Transport'.

answers.answer: Free language courses and activities are available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania, suitable for both children and adults.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Language courses and activities'.

answers.answer: If you have used drugs and need help, you can look for accessible support services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Support for drug users'.

answers.answer: You can seek mental health support to talk openly about war trauma and manage its effects on your well-being and mental health.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Mental health services for refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: An online map created by UNHCR can help you find a list of organizations that provide various kinds of assistance to refugees from Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Map of organizations helping refugees from Ukraine'.

answers.answer: You can learn more about the process of integrating refugees from Ukraine into Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Integration of refugees from Ukraine to Romania'.

answers.answer: On Sprijin de Urgență, one can offer resources, food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteer services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/sprijin and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
